item.title: Report E-2025030056
item.description:
Report E-2025030056

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-05T18:18:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-05
  • City: MONTGOMERY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 9000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-XNW contacted ERTS regarding a leaking 55-gallon DF containing hazardous product, VORTEXX. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 5-gallons of product released onto the wooden trailer floor in a 4’x4’ area as a result of improper loading. The contractor applied simple green to the release and overpacked the leaking drum into one 95-gallon DF for waste disposal. The impacted absorbent pads and PPE were containerized into a separate drum for waste disposal. XPO will manage all waste created from the spill response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

item.title: Report X-2025030003
item.description:
Report X-2025030003

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-04T15:15:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-28
  • City: TONAWANDA
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: John Ognibene, 026 Operation Supervisor, contacted Safety regarding a UN3265 corrosive liquid spill on the trailer and dock floor. John Ognibene advised he noticed the spill while walking the dock. John Ognibene stated it's unknown if any of the commodity struck the yard due to it being dark and the product being clear. John Ognibene advised both sides of the drum are caved in but is unknown if that's what caused the spill. John Ognibene stated the drum is still leaking so he moved the drum off the trailer, down the dock by the dumpster to be out of the way of workers. John Ognibene asked if h e could place wood chips over the spill and Safety advised yes to can contain the spill. Safety contacted Mattisyn Keys with Cura for remediation. ~~Safety advised Mattisyn Keys to advise Safety if any struck the yard and if the spill becomes reportable. Safety also requested the cause of the spill. ~~Update from Cura- "It took some time to get a contractor to respond earlier this morning. The crew just wrapped up at the terminal, completing removal of the environmental concern. The drums looked to have been compressed inside the trailer, causing the release. I am not finding any ingredients o n this product to be reportable."

item.title: Report E-2025020406
item.description:
Report E-2025020406

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-01T21:20:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-21
  • City: PORT CHESTER
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SUTTLES TRUCK LEASING, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 21, 2025, at 1242 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) were contacted by Suttles Truck Leasing LLC, personnel in Port Chester, NY regarding the release of approximately (1) quart of Unisol Liquid Red BK-50, (Flammable liquid, n.o.s., (Kerosene (Petroleum), Xylenes), UN1993, 3, III) from a hose. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. Upon arrival contractors were informed facility personnel had already performed all cleanup operations, and will manage the waste.
